creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: night scene: two women in kimono with umbrella peer into a shop window at LL; reflection from warm indoor lights on wet street; in middle ground, a multi-story building with bicycle parked in front and illuminated paper lanterns contrasts against the dark night scene
inscription: left: 自摺　昭和八年作　京都之夜 {jizuri, Shōwa hachinen saku, Kyoto no yoru} | bottom, printed: Night in Kyoto | in pencil: Hiroshi Yoshida
markings: LRC, red artist\'s seal A: 博 {Hiroshi}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
title: Night in Kyoto
